details.body:
The following table shows the types of payment most frequently made under site agreements (see [EIM13825](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13825.htm)) and the appropriate tax treatment. See [EIM13832](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13832.htm) for the report to be made in certain cases.
### Type of payment ### Tax treatment
Completion bonus or time-saved payment: this is a sum paid for completing a contract before a specified date. Payment for completing a project on time. Retention payment: this is based on the number of hours worked.Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM00515](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00515.htm)). The sum is a reward for services in the form of a contractually guaranteed terminal payment (see [EIM13765](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13765.htm)).
Severance payment (excluding a statutory redundancy payment). Usually related to length of service and paid where an employment lasts less than 2 years.May satisfy the definition of payments for redundancy (see [EIM13800](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13800.htm)) and so fall within Section 401 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM13775](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13775.htm)). Otherwise, Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM00515](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00515.htm)).
Payment in lieu of notice (PILON).See [EIM12975](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12975.htm)
Statutory redundancy payment made under Employment Rights Act 1996 or Northern Ireland equivalent (see [EIM13760](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13760.htm)).Section 401 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM13760](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13760.htm)).
